thread.title: Extreme 3ds max newbie looking for modeling tuts.

post.author: tweakman
post.body:
Is there any really basic tuts for real beginners. About the only thing I can do is create primitives but then what?

I tried the tuts listed by _Shank but both assume experience with MAX.

Please help lame me!!!!!

post.author: BloodRayne
post.body:
Hundreds of beginner tutorials for 3dsMax: http://www.google.nl/search?hl=nl&q=3ds ... ginner&lr=

Allways nice to see new people getting interested in 3dsMax, so good luck!

post.author: tweakman
post.body:
Thanks for the encouragement. I hope to be able to do my own modeling soon. I am a programmer and have done some team work on a Java Card Game, and did a clone of Tetris in Visual Basic.Net. But I want to do all aspects of game development so I can do a complete game by myself.
With a lot of work I may be able to accomplish this feat.

post.author: obsidian
post.body: Some of the best resources for beginners are the ones that come with MAX. Check the tutorial resources, they're in HTML help files and offer quite a number of interesting topics.

post.author: ajerara
post.body: I was just on 3D buzz.com and they had a lot of web tutorials for 3D studio Max. grabbed a bunch for myself.

post.author: xwarpedx
post.body: 3dtotal.com is an excelent source for tutorials. the forums at threedy.com are another great place to ask questions/post your work.

post.author: merlin371
post.body: if you register on 3dbuzz.com they also have VTMs which are really good
